title: Dear Richard Madeley: 'If I give money to support girls going to STEM events, is that unfair on the boys?'
text:
Dear Richard

I am the mother of two children in the early stage of secondary school. I also have a fairly senior job in medical research: after half a century of slow progress, women at my level in the industry are still in a small minority. I would like my daughter to look forward to a future where she can choose a career for herself with the same sense of freedom as my son.

Yet when my children’s school holds voluntary coding workshops and science trips, for example, the uptake is significantly greater for boys than for girls. The proportion of boys taking STEM [science, technology, engineering and maths] subjects at GCSE is lower now than 10 years ago but in some areas, such as computing,...
